Mike Czarny Tinkerer. Hacker. Engineer.

About Me Projects

My Background

Originally from Poland, now living in LA (not limited to), I am a systems and network engineer with a passion for building and automating (and all the fun stuff in between). Some would call this DevOps/SysOps/NetOps/SRE. I've had some success in both startup and corporate enviroments having worn many hats during a seven year career. I love to learn new technologies, and as a result my focus has recently shifted from traditional cloud and bare-metal services to blockchain technology and cryptocurrency, an area that I'm excited about contributing to, and which I believe will become the next disruptive layer of the internet.

Systems

Create simple solutions to complex problems with open source tools

Networks

Build resilent, performant and secure networks at scale

DevOps

Design and document tools to streamline engineering workflows

Featured Projects

Overseer - Server and Network Monitoring

  • Nagios based - Industry standard
  • Language agnostic
  • Highly customizable

A collection of Python and Bash service monitors for Nagios used by high traffic services such as MaxCDN and StackPath.

Check it out

Scout - Monitoring All the Things

  • Fast
  • Clean UI

A monitoring stack for anything and everything using InfluxDB, Grafana and Telegraf.

Check it out

Cryptocurrency Blog - Author

  • Six Things I Wish I'd Known as a Cryptocurrency Newbie
  • How to Use Bitcoin Exchanges: A Step-By-Step Guide

Contributor to cryptochill.com. My goal is to share the cryptocurrency and blockchain knowledge that I've acquired.

Check it out

FifaDB - Personal Stats for FIFA Gameplay

  • MySQL
  • Python
  • UI in development

FIFA doesn't provide an ingame way to track your statistics, so I built my own.

Check it out

BotMan - Cryptocurrency Bot

  • Written in Python

A Discord bot that displays cryptocurrency prices and trends using the Cryptocompare.com API.
